lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/barcelona.barcelona.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run barcelona.barcelona.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A simple chatbot application for managing tasks.
* The {@code Barcelona} provides an interactive command-line interface
* where users can add, manage, and search for tasks. Tasks are stored
* in a {@link TaskList}, and can be of type {@link barcelona.task.Todos},

*
  • Maintain a list of tasks in memory.
*   <li>Support for multiple task types: Todo, Deadline & Event

*
  • View all current tasks in the list.

*
  • LIST – List all tasks in the {@link TaskList}.

*
  • MARK <index> – Mark the task at the given index as done.

*
  • UNMARK <index> – Unmark (undo) the task at the given index.

*
  • DELETE <index> – Delete the task at the given index.

*
  • FIND <keyword> – Search for tasks containing the given keyword in their description.
* @param filepath - filepath to saved tasklist memory

* If valid, it will update the tasklist & set the write
* location to the new file location
* @param filepath - Filepath to the new txt file

* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* The {@code Deadline} class extends {@link Task} by adding a due date
* to the task's description. This allows tasks to be tracked not only
* by their description, but also by when they must be completed.
DateTimeFormatter outputFormatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMMM yyyy, h:mma");
* Represents an event with a start and end date.
* The {@code Event} class extends {@link Task} by associating the task
* description with a specific time frame (start and end date).
* This makes it suitable for tasks that occur over a period of time,
* such as meetings, workshops, or trips.

* The {@code Task} class is an abstract representation of something
* that needs to be done. It stores a textual description of the task
* and can be extended by more specific task types (e.g., {@link Todos}).
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
